events.event_description: U.S. associated natural gas production increased by 7.9% to average 17.1 billion cubic feet per day in 2023 compared to 2022.
events.citation: U.S. production of associated-dissolved natural gas, or associated natural gas, increased 7.9% in 2023 compared with 2022, averaging 17.1 billion cubic feet per day (Bcf/d) last year, according to data from Enverus Drillinginfo.

events.event_description: The Permian Basin achieved record production levels, accounting for 46% of U.S. crude oil production and producing 11.5 Bcf/d of associated gas in 2023.
events.citation: The Permian Basin in West Texas and southeastern New Mexico accounted for 46% of U.S. crude oil production in 2023 and was the largest source of U.S. associated gas production last year at 11.5 Bcf/d.

events.event_description: North Dakota's Bakken region produced 2.3 Bcf/d of associated gas, representing 70% of the region's total natural gas production in 2023.
events.citation: In 2023, 2.3 Bcf/d of associated gas was produced in North Dakota's Bakken region, which accounted for 70% of the region's total natural gas production—the largest share among the five oil-producing regions.

events.event_description: The Eagle Ford region in southern Texas produced 1.8 Bcf/d of associated gas, while the Niobrara and Anadarko regions combined produced 1.5 Bcf/d in 2023.
events.citation: The Eagle Ford region in southern Texas was the source of 1.8 Bcf/d of associated gas, while a combined 1.5 Bcf/d of associated gas was produced in the Niobrara and Anadarko regions in the midcontinent in 2023.

events.event_description: Associated natural gas production led to record ethane production, which is used as feedstock for plastics and fibers.
events.citation: The increase in associated gas has led to record ethane production, which is used as a feedstock to produce plastics, fibers, and other products.
